title: oc-833  -  htaccess incorrect for apache installs using alias
body:
from http://bugs.owncloud.org/thebuggenie/owncloud/issues/oc-833

the behaviour with v4.5.4 is still as described in the report. please determine what the appropriate action is.

description:
i have owncloud installed in http://localhost/owncloud, and the files are not under document root (but installed in /usr/local/share/owncloud). the mod_rewrite caldav/carddav redirects created in the .htaccess file lack the rewrite base directive required for relative path redirects (see http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/mod/mod_rewrite.html). modifying the .htaccess file with the following fixes the problem:

rewrite base /owncloud/ rewrite rule ^apps/calendar/caldav.php(.*) remote.php/caldav$1 qsa,r rewrite rule ^apps/contacts/carddav.php(.*) remote.php/carddav$1 qsa,r

setup.php should automatically detect non-toplevel installs and create the correct .htaccess file.

(note, the rewrite rule entries need a 'r' not 'l' redirects, as the internal redirects don't appear to work correctly with remote.php).

reproduction steps:

    install owncloud someplace that's not under document root (eg /usr/local/share/owncloud)
    create an alias from /owncloud to the install directory (alias /owncloud /usr/local/share/owncloud)
    add "allowoverride options file info" in directory directive for /usr/local/share/owncloud
    run setup
    note that created .htaccess file lacks rewrite base
    navigate to http://localhost/owncloud/apps/calendar/caldav.php/calendars/
    receive 404 not found
    add rewrite base /owncloud/
    navigate to url again
    receive the error "no input file specified"
    modify the rewrite rules replacing l redirects with r.
    navigate to url again
    receive correct calendar listing.
